definition: to harmonize/to reconcile/to blend/to suit well/to adjust/to regulate/to season (food)/to provoke/to incite
to transfer/to move (troops or cadres)/to investigate/to enquire into/accent/view/argument/key (in music)/mode (music)/tune/tone/melody

gate/door/CL:扇[shan4]/gateway/doorway/CL:個|个[ge4]/opening/valve/switch/way to do something/knack/family/house/(religious) sect/school (of thought)/class/category/phylum or division (taxonomy)/classifier for large guns/classifier for lessons, subjects, branches of technology/(suffix) -gate (i.e. scandal; derived from Watergate)
erhua variant of 調門|调门[diao4 men2]

sentences.english: Emboldened by the current global financial crisis, anti-free-market critics have grown increasingly boisterous.
sentences.chinese: 當前的全球金融危機讓反對自由市場的調門越來越高。

sentences.english: A number of reviews took the same line.
sentences.chinese: 評論文章的調門兒都一樣。
她唱不到這樣低的調門。

sentences.english: The non-symmetric steam admission is another important source of the steam excitation force.
sentences.chinese: 調門不對稱進汽也是蒸汽激振力的另一個重要來源。

sentences.english: She has set the tune too low.
sentences.chinese: 她把調門兒起得太低了。
我唱不了那麼高的調門兒。
